job description:
Maj

Application Scientist, Farmingdale NY

Major Responsibilities:

This position is responsible for providing technical information for customer inquiries across a wide range of products. The Applications Scientist will serve as a support liaison to the company’s customers, provide scientific support to the sales team and distributors, including up to 50% travel. The Applications Scientist will also provide marketing support for strategic initiatives.


Specific Duties:


1. Answer complex questions, troubleshooting and data analysis inquiries via phone and email on the usage and performance of Enzo and Axxora products requiring detailed knowledge of:


  1. Molecular biology, chemistry, biochemistry, cell biology, and pharmacology
  2. Scientific theory and practice, and the scientific method
  3. Laboratory techniques including cell biology, western blotting, immunohistochemistry, immunoprecipitation, ELISA, flow cytometry, enzyme assays, and pharmacological approaches.

2. Analyze data and primary literature to identify and solve problems related to the laboratory techniques described above.


3. Recommend products and applications of products in response to customer inquiries.


4. Interact and follow up with customers and internal staff to resolve customer inquiries.


5. Document communication related to customer inquiries and technical support resolution in the case management database (Salesforce.com) to facilitate case tracking and follow-up.


6. Read, review, and keep up-to-date with product literature to maintain a current and thorough understanding of all products.


7. Provide scientific support to Account Managers and distributors by attending scientific conferences, giving presentations, and visiting customers.


8. Provide online or on-site training to the sales team and distributors.


9. Develop and conduct on-site customer training for the implementation of Enzo products.


10. Provide marketing support for strategic initiatives.


11. Create marketing collateral in the form of Application Notes to support Enzo products.


12. Monitor customer feedback and competitors to maintain understanding of the marketplace.


13. Develop and conduct training programs for distributors and direct sales team.

14. Other duties as assigned by supervisor.


REQUIREMENTS:

Education: Advanced Degree in a scientific field

Experience: 3+ years of technical support, laboratory, or equivalent experience or 1 years of technical support experience in a life science reagents company. Prior supervisory experience

Skills: Excellent problem solving and investigative skills. Ability to resolve varied non-routine scientific challenges. Excellent written and oral English communication skills and a strong customer service focus. Strong analytical and documentation skills, follow-up, attention to detail, and technical adeptness. Basic business math skills. Ability to work in a team environment. Must be flexible in responding to changing demands. Computer proficiency required.

Travel: Up to 50%
